briefdescription.para: Create a net_pkt slab.

detaileddescription.para: A net_pkt slab is used to store meta-information about network packets. It must be coupled with a data fragment pool (:c:macro:NET_PKT_DATA_POOL_DEFINE) used to store the actual packet data. The macro can be used by an application to define additional custom per-context TX packet slabs (see :c:func:net_context_setup_pools).

parameterdescription.para: Name of the slab.
Number of net_pkt in this slab.

briefdescription.para: Create a data fragment net_buf pool.

detaileddescription.para: A net_buf pool is used to store actual data for network packets. It must be coupled with a net_pkt slab (:c:macro:NET_PKT_SLAB_DEFINE) used to store the packet meta-information. The macro can be used by an application to define additional custom per-context TX packet pools (see :c:func:net_context_setup_pools).

parameterdescription.para: Name of the pool.
Number of net_buf in this pool.

briefdescription.para: Print fragment list and the fragment sizes.

detaileddescription.para: Only available if debugging is activated.

parameterdescription.para: Network pkt.

briefdescription.para: Get RX DATA buffer from pool. Normally you should use net_pkt_get_frag() instead.

detaileddescription.para: Normally this version is not useful for applications but is mainly used by network fragmentation code.

parameterdescription.para: Affects the action taken should the net buf pool be empty. If K_NO_WAIT, then return immediately. If K_FOREVER, then wait as long as necessary. Otherwise, wait up to the specified time.

simplesect.para: Network buffer if successful, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get TX DATA buffer from pool. Normally you should use net_pkt_get_frag() instead.

detaileddescription.para: Normally this version is not useful for applications but is mainly used by network fragmentation code.

parameterdescription.para: Affects the action taken should the net buf pool be empty. If K_NO_WAIT, then return immediately. If K_FOREVER, then wait as long as necessary. Otherwise, wait up to the specified time.

simplesect.para: Network buffer if successful, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get a data fragment that might be from user specific buffer pool or from global DATA pool.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet.
Affects the action taken should the net buf pool be empty. If K_NO_WAIT, then return immediately. If K_FOREVER, then wait as long as necessary. Otherwise, wait up to the specified time.

simplesect.para: Network buffer if successful, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Place packet back into the available packets slab.

detaileddescription.para: Releases the packet to other use. This needs to be called by application after it has finished with the packet.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet to release.

briefdescription.para: Increase the packet ref count.

detaileddescription.para: Mark the packet to be used still.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet to ref.

simplesect.para: Network packet if successful, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Increase the packet fragment ref count.

detaileddescription.para: Mark the fragment to be used still.

parameterdescription.para: Network fragment to ref.

simplesect.para: a pointer on the referenced Network fragment.

briefdescription.para: Decrease the packet fragment ref count.

parameterdescription.para: Network fragment to unref.

briefdescription.para: Delete existing fragment from a packet.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet from which frag belongs to.
parent fragment of frag, or NULL if none.
Fragment to delete.

simplesect.para: Pointer to the following fragment, or NULL if it had no further fragments.

briefdescription.para: Add a fragment to a packet at the end of its fragment list.

parameterdescription.para: pkt Network packet where to add the fragment
Fragment to add

briefdescription.para: Insert a fragment to a packet at the beginning of its fragment list.

parameterdescription.para: pkt Network packet where to insert the fragment
Fragment to insert

briefdescription.para: Compact the fragment list of a packet.

detaileddescription.para:
After this there is no more any free space in individual fragments.
pkt
Network packet.
True if compact success, False otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct k_mem_slab **rx, struct k_mem_slab **tx, struct net_buf_pool **rx_data, struct net_buf_pool **tx_data)
memberdef.name: net_pkt_get_info

briefdescription.para: Get information about predefined RX, TX and DATA pools.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to RX pool is returned.
Pointer to TX pool is returned.
Pointer to RX DATA pool is returned.
Pointer to TX DATA pool is returned.

briefdescription.para: Allocate an initialized net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: for the time being, 2 pools are used. One for TX and one for RX. This allocator has to be used for TX.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum time to wait for an allocation.

simplesect.para: a pointer to a newly allocated net_pkt on success, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Allocate an initialized net_pkt from a specific slab.

detaileddescription.para: unlike net_pkt_alloc() which uses core slabs, this one will use an external slab (see NET_PKT_SLAB_DEFINE()). Do not use it unless you know what you are doing. Basically, only net_context should be using this, in order to allocate packet and then buffer on its local slab/pool (if any).

parameterdescription.para: The slab to use for allocating the packet
Maximum time to wait for an allocation.

simplesect.para: a pointer to a newly allocated net_pkt on success, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Allocate an initialized net_pkt for RX.

detaileddescription.para: for the time being, 2 pools are used. One for TX and one for RX. This allocator has to be used for RX.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum time to wait for an allocation.

simplesect.para: a pointer to a newly allocated net_pkt on success, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Allocate a network packet for a specific network interface.

parameterdescription.para: The network interface the packet is supposed to go through.
Maximum time to wait for an allocation.

simplesect.para: a pointer to a newly allocated net_pkt on success, NULL otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct net_pkt *pkt, size_t size, enum net_ip_protocol proto, k_timeout_t timeout)
memberdef.name: net_pkt_alloc_buffer

briefdescription.para: Allocate buffer for a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: : such allocator will take into account space necessary for headers, MTU, and existing buffer (if any). Beware that, due to all these criteria, the allocated size might be smaller/bigger than requested one.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet requiring buffer to be allocated.
The size of buffer being requested.
The IP protocol type (can be 0 for none).
Maximum time to wait for an allocation.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct net_if *iface, size_t size, sa_family_t family, enum net_ip_protocol proto, k_timeout_t timeout)
memberdef.name: net_pkt_alloc_with_buffer

briefdescription.para: Allocate a network packet and buffer at once.

parameterdescription.para: The network interface the packet is supposed to go through.
The size of buffer.
The family to which the packet belongs.
The IP protocol type (can be 0 for none).
Maximum time to wait for an allocation.

simplesect.para: a pointer to a newly allocated net_pkt on success, NULL otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct net_if *iface, size_t size, sa_family_t family, enum net_ip_protocol proto, k_timeout_t timeout)
memberdef.name: net_pkt_rx_alloc_with_buffer

briefdescription.para: Append a buffer in packet.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet where to append the buffer
Buffer to append

briefdescription.para: Get available buffer space from a pkt.

simplesect.para: Reserved bytes (headroom) in any of the fragments are not considered to be available.

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt which buffer availability should be evaluated

simplesect.para: the amount of buffer available

briefdescription.para: Get available buffer space for payload from a pkt.

detaileddescription.para:
Reserved bytes (headroom) in any of the fragments are not considered to be available.
Unlike net_pkt_available_buffer(), this will take into account the headers space.

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt which payload buffer availability should be evaluated
The IP protocol type (can be 0 for none).

simplesect.para: the amount of buffer available for payload

briefdescription.para: Trim net_pkt buffer.

detaileddescription.para: This will basically check for unused buffers and deallocates them relevantly

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt which buffer will be trimmed

briefdescription.para: Remove length bytes from tail of packet.

detaileddescription.para: This function does not take packet cursor into account. It is a helper to remove unneeded bytes from tail of packet (like appended CRC). It takes care of buffer deallocation if removed bytes span whole buffer(s).

parameterdescription.para: Network packet
Number of bytes to be removed
On success.
If packet length is shorter than length.

briefdescription.para: Initialize net_pkt cursor.

detaileddescription.para: This will initialize the net_pkt cursor from its buffer.

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt whose cursor is going to be initialized

briefdescription.para: Backup net_pkt cursor.

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt whose cursor is going to be backed up
The cursor where to backup net_pkt cursor

briefdescription.para: Restore net_pkt cursor from a backup.

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt whose cursor is going to be restored
The cursor from where to restore net_pkt cursor

briefdescription.para: Returns current position of the cursor.

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt whose cursor position is going to be returned

simplesect.para: cursor's position

briefdescription.para: Skip some data from a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized Cursor position will be updated after the operation. Depending on the value of pkt->overwrite bit, this function will affect the buffer length or not. If it's true, it will advance the cursor to the requested length. If it's false, it will do the same but if the cursor was already also at the end of existing data, it will increment the buffer length. So in this case, its behavior is just like net_pkt_write or net_pkt_memset, difference being that it will not affect the buffer content itself (which may be just garbage then).

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt whose cursor will be updated to skip given amount of data from the buffer.
Amount of data to skip in the buffer

simplesect.para: 0 in success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Memset some data in a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The net_pkt whose buffer to fill starting at the current cursor position.
The byte to write in memory
Amount of data to memset with given byte

simplesect.para: 0 in success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Copy data from a packet into another one.

detaileddescription.para: Both net_pkt cursors should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. The cursors will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: Destination network packet.
Source network packet.
Length of data to be copied.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Clone pkt and its buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Original pkt to be cloned
Timeout to wait for free buffer

simplesect.para: NULL if error, cloned packet otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Clone pkt and increase the refcount of its buffer.

parameterdescription.para: Original pkt to be shallow cloned
Timeout to wait for free packet

simplesect.para: NULL if error, cloned packet otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Read some data from a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet from where to read some data
The destination buffer where to copy the data
The amount of data to copy

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Read uint16_t big endian data from a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet from where to read
The destination uint16_t where to copy the data

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Read uint16_t little endian data from a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet from where to read
The destination uint16_t where to copy the data

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Read uint32_t big endian data from a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet from where to read
The destination uint32_t where to copy the data

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Write data into a net_pkt.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet where to write
Data to be written
Length of the data to be written

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the amount of data which can be read from current cursor position.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet

simplesect.para: Amount of data which can be read from current pkt cursor

briefdescription.para: Update the overall length of a packet.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike net_pkt_pull() below, this does not take packet cursor into account. It's mainly a helper dedicated for ipv4 and ipv6 input functions. It shrinks the overall length by given parameter.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet
The new length of the packet

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Remove data from the packet at current location.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, eventually, properly positioned using net_pkt_skip/read/write. Note that net_pkt's cursor is reset by this function.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet
Number of bytes to be removed

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the actual offset in the packet from its cursor.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet.

simplesect.para: a valid offset on success, 0 otherwise as there is nothing that can be done to evaluate the offset.

briefdescription.para: Check if a data size could fit contiguously.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip.

parameterdescription.para: Network packet.
The size to check for contiguity

simplesect.para: true if that is the case, false otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Get the contiguous buffer space

parameterdescription.para: Network packet

simplesect.para: The available contiguous buffer space in bytes starting from the current cursor position. 0 in case of an error.

briefdescription.para: Get data from a network packet in a contiguous way.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet from where to get the data.
A pointer to a valid net_pkt_data_access describing the data to get in a contiguous way.

simplesect.para: a pointer to the requested contiguous data, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Set contiguous data into a network packet.

detaileddescription.para: net_pkt's cursor should be properly initialized and, if needed, positioned using net_pkt_skip. Cursor position will be updated after the operation.

parameterdescription.para: The network packet to where the data should be set.
A pointer to a valid net_pkt_data_access describing the data to set.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, a negative errno otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Acknowledge previously contiguous data taken from a network packet Packet needs to be set to overwrite mode.

briefdescription.para: Network packet buffer descriptor API.

detaileddescription.para: Network data is passed between different parts of the stack via net_buf struct.
